name: Necrophage Ghoul
description: After the Northern Wars, necrophages generally grew bolder and multiplied in the Northern Kingdoms; ghouls, a sub-species, became the most common corpse-eaters, usually found roaming around in packs, distinguishable from their cousins, alghouls, by the sickly paleness of their visage.
whenDamagedReminder: [Necrophage Stench:] All creatures within 5 feet must make a DC 8 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned.

passives.name: Necrophage Stench
passives.description: Whenever a necrophage receives damage, all creatures within 5 feet of it must make a DC 8 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned.

passives.name: Feeding Frenzy
passives.description: Necrophages gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls for each creature who has died in its presence during combat.

actions.name: Necrophagy
actions.description: A necrophage may use a bonus action to feast on a corpse that died no more than 3 days ago, and heal five times the level of the creature.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The archer makes one Claws and one Bite attack.

actions.name: Claws
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an elf or undead, it must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature other than an elf or undead, it must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the end of its next turn.
